snippet: Researchers around the world studied six extreme weather events from 2011 and published the results in six months.
abstract: Philip W Mote study in Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society finds that extreme weather around the globe has become far more likely than it was in the past due to human-induced global warming; findings represent an increased effort by scientists to respond to a public clamor for information about what is happening to the earth’s climate.
lead_paragraph: Researchers around the world studied six extreme weather events from 2011 and published the results in six months.

headline.main: Global Warming Makes Heat Waves More Likely, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Global Warming Makes Heat Waves More Likely, Study Finds
